meanings.definition: Covered with a thin layer of gold
meanings.sent1: The gilded frame around the mirror sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The gilded crown on the king's head symbolized his royal status.
meanings.sent3: The gilded statue looked like a shiny treasure in the museum.
meanings.sent4: Her gilded bracelet was a symbol of her elegance and wealth.
meanings.sent5: The gilded chandelier illuminated the grand ballroom with a golden glow.

meanings.sent1: The gilded family lived in a mansion with a large garden.
meanings.sent2: She wore a gilded necklace that shimmered with luxury.
meanings.sent3: The gilded guests at the party arrived in fancy cars.
meanings.sent4: His gilded lifestyle allowed him to travel the world in style.
meanings.sent5: The gilded yacht sailed gracefully on the sparkling blue sea.

meanings.definition: To cover with a thin layer of gold
meanings.sent1: She carefully gilded the edges of the picture frame.
meanings.sent2: The artist gilded the statue to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: He decided to gild the vase as a special gift for his mother.
meanings.sent4: The craftsman gilded the intricate design with precision.
meanings.sent5: They planned to gild the entire gate to make it stand out.

meanings.definition: To give a deceptively attractive appearance
meanings.sent1: The company tried to gild their products with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She knew how to gild her words to win people over.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to gild the situation only made things worse.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to gild his image with empty gestures.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement was designed to gild the mediocre product.
